title: 107_hr2310
content:
The "Military Pay Raise Act of 2001" increases monthly basic pay for uniformed services members effective January 1, 2002, based on pay grade and years of service. Commissioned officers' pay grades and percentage increases based on years of service under section 205 of title 37, United States Code are as follows:
- O-10: 7.3%
- O-9: 7.3%
- O-8: 7.3%
- O-7: 7.3%
- O-6: 7.3% Commissioned officers' pay grades from O-1 to O-9 receive percentage increases ranging from 7.3% to 9.0% based on years of service. Commissioned officers' pay grades from O-1 to O-9 receive percentage increases ranging from 7.3% to 9.0% based on years of service. The pay percentages for different ranks are as follows: O-1 to O-3 receive 8.3%, while O-7 to O-10 receive 7.3%. Commissioned officers' pay grades from O-1 to O-9 receive percentage increases ranging from 7.3% to 9.0% based on years of service. The pay percentages for different ranks are as follows: O-1 to O-3 receive 8.3%, while O-7 to O-10 receive 7.3%. Commissioned officers' pay grades from O-1 to O-9 receive percentage increases ranging from 7.3% to 9.0% based on years of service. The pay percentages for different ranks are as follows: O-1 to O-3 receive 8.3%, while O-7 to O-10 receive 7.3%. The pay percentages for officers over 18, 20, 22, 24, and 26 years of service are all 7.3%. Commissioned officers' pay grades from O-1 to O-9 receive percentage increases ranging from 7.3% to 9.0% based on years of service. The pay percentages for different ranks are as follows: O-1 to O-3 receive 8.3%, while O-7 to O-10 receive 7.3%. Commissioned officers' pay grades from O-1 to O-5 receive percentage increases ranging from 7.3% to 9.0% based on years of service. Commissioned officers with over 4 years of active duty service as an enlisted member or warrant officer receive percentage increases ranging from 7.3% to 8.3% based on pay grade. Commissioned officers with over 4 years of active duty service receive percentage increases ranging from 7.3% to 8.3% based on pay grade, with higher percentages for higher ranks. Commissioned officers with over 4 years of active duty service receive percentage increases ranging from 7.3% to 8.3% based on pay grade, with higher percentages for higher ranks. The percentage increases are distributed across different age brackets, with increments of 2 years starting from over 18 years old. Warrant officers receive percentage increases ranging from 7.5% to 8.5% based on pay grade and years of service. Warrant officers receive percentage increases ranging from 7.5% to 8.5% based on pay grade and years of service, with incremental increases for each level. Warrant officers receive percentage increases ranging from 7.5% to 8.5% based on pay grade and years of service, with incremental increases for each level. The percentage increases are distributed across different age brackets, starting from over 18 years old. Warrant officers receive percentage increases ranging from 7.5% to 8.5% based on pay grade and years of service, with incremental increases for each level. The increases are distributed across different age brackets, starting from over 18 years old. Enlisted members receive percentage increases ranging from 8.5% to 10.5% based on pay grade and years of service, with incremental increases for each level. Enlisted members receive percentage increases ranging from 7.3% to 10.0% based on pay grade, with incremental increases for each level. Enlisted members receive percentage increases ranging from 7.3% to 10.5% based on pay grade, with incremental increases for each level. Enlisted members receive percentage increases ranging from 7.3% to 10.5% based on pay grade, with incremental increases for each level. The pay grades E-1 to E-8 show increases of 7.3% to 10.0% across different age brackets. Enlisted members receive percentage increases ranging from 7.3% to 10.5% based on pay grade, with incremental increases for each level. The pay grades E-1 to E-8 show increases of 7.3% to 10.0% across different age brackets, with E-9 having a consistent increase of 10.5% across all age brackets. Enlisted members receive percentage increases ranging from 7.3% to 10.5% based on pay grade, with incremental increases for each level. The pay grades E-1 to E-8 show increases of 7.3% to 10.0% across different age brackets. The adjustment to monthly basic pay rates for uniformed services members in fiscal year 2002 required by section 1009 of title 37, United States Code, will not be made.
